item.title: basic concepts of a compiler
item.description: What is a Compiler? A Compiler is like a machine, which turns high-level, human-readable code into binray code. At its core, a compiler is a software tool that takes your source code written in a high-level programming language (like Python, Java, or C++) and converts it into a lower-level representation, usually machine code or assembly language. This process enables computers to execute your program’s instructions. Parts of a Compiler A compiler consists of several stages, each with a specific purpose:
